intro: Adicea boiviniana, commonly known as the Boivin's adicea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. It is known for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this endangered species from habitat loss.
